title: The number 486 has been divided into three parts in such a way that one third of the first part, fourth of the second part, and half of the third part are equal. What is the largest part? - Quora

response.answer_text: Suppose, the first, second and third parts are a, b and c respectively. So, (a + b + c) = 486……………………(1) And, (a / 3) = (b / 4) = (c / 2) = x……………….(2) So, a = 3x, b = 4x and c = 2x. Since, x is positive; so, clearly, b > a > c. Putting these in (1): (3x + 4x + 2x) = 486 9x = 486 x = (486 / 9) = 54. Therefore, the largest part = the second part = 4x = (4 * 54) = 216.

Let the first part be x. The second part be y and the third part z 1/3x =1/4y = 1/2z X/3 = y/4= z/2 = K ( say) Also x + y + z = 486 X = 3k Y = 4k Z = 2k 9k = 486 therefore k = 54 X/3 =54 hence X = 162 Y/4 =54 hence Y = 216 Z/2 = 54 hence Z = 108 Therefore the second part 216 is the largest part.
